p:
To gain direct molecular-scale insight into the hydration of birnessite, molecular dynamics (MD) simulations of K +-saturated birnessite at different water loadings were also undertaken. The lattice of one UC
14 was expanded into a system containing 6 × 12 × 4 UCs, with a composition of K 144[Mn 576O 1152] × (H 2O) 3840. This initial composition corresponded to an average of 0.25 K + ions and 13.333 water molecules per UC. After energy minimization and 2 ns of volume and pressure optimization, 61 × 3 ns successive production runs in the isobaric–isothermal ensemble ( NPT) were performed at decreasing water loadings. This was realized by successively evaporating a constant number of randomly selected water molecules (0.22 water molecules per UC per step) from each interlayer region, while preserving the same d 001 of each interlayer at each step. Each evaporation step was followed by a 100 ps of pre-equilibration run not included in the analysis.
